Title: QARC Project Execution
Description: Brno University of Technology coordinates EU Horizon QARC (Quantum-Resistant Cryptography in Practice) project focusing on hybrid schemes cryptographic agility and real-world PQC deployment pilots across EU eGovernment and cloud infrastructures.

Title: Quantum Safe Explorer Launched
Description: IBM launches Quantum Safe Explorer tool to help organizations scan source and object code to identify cryptographic assets dependencies and vulnerabilities creating a CBOM.

Title: IBM Heron R2 Processor Available
Description: IBM makes Heron R2 processor available with 156 qubits designed to enable more complex quantum circuits with low error rates facilitating quantum utility at scale.

Title: IBM Next-Gen Processor Development
Description: IBM advances development of its next-generation modular quantum processor incorporating features for high-efficiency quantum error correction targeting early 2026 testing milestones.

Title: IBM Kookaburra Processor Released
Description: IBM releases Kookaburra first modular 1386-qubit processor designed to store and process encoded information combining quantum memory with logic operations.

Title: IBM Quantum Advantage Target
Description: IBM targets achieving and verifying quantum advantage demonstrating verifiable speed-ups over classical computing for meaningful tasks.

Title: Quantum Safe Program Launch
Description: Microsoft formally launches Quantum Safe Program (QSP) to build quantum-safe future across all products and services.

Title: Majorana 1 Quantum Chip
Description: Microsoft announces development of Majorana 1 quantum chip.

Title: Microsoft QSP Roadmap Published
Description: Microsoft publishes comprehensive roadmap detailing progress toward next-generation cryptography and 2033 completion target.

Title: Core Infrastructure Transition
Description: Microsoft accelerates QSP transition for core infrastructure including signing services and network services starting in 2026 with Windows Azure M365 integration beginning 2027.

Title: Early Quantum-Safe Adoption
Description: Microsoft begins early adoption of quantum-safe capabilities across products and services with quantum-safe systems gradually becoming default.

Title: Microsoft Full PQC Transition
Description: Microsoft completes full transition to quantum-ready cryptographic standards across all products and services. Two years ahead of 2035 government deadlines.

Title: UltraPQ-Suite Launched
Description: PQShield launches UltraPQ-Suite collection of specialized PQC implementations including PQPlatform-TrustSys quantum-safe Root of Trust for ASIC/FPGA CNSA 2.0 compliance.

Title: 100th Research Paper Milestone
Description: PQShield releases 100th research paper achieving 24 top-tier conference papers in 2025 including Distinguished Paper Award at CCS.

Title: Carahsoft Government Partnership
Description: PQShield partners with Carahsoft to make PQC solutions accessible to US government agencies.

Title: Post-Quantum VPN Research Initiated
Description: PQShield initiates new research into Post-Quantum VPNs and expands formal verification efforts for real-world FHE operations.

Title: AQtive Guard Pentagon 5-Year Agreement
Description: SandboxAQ secures five-year agreement with Department of Defense CIO (formerly referred to as Department of War CIO per late-2025 rebranding) to deploy AQtive Guard cybersecurity platform across Pentagon systems for automated cryptographic discovery inventory and managed PQC transition. Paves way for other DoD agencies.

Title: AQtive Guard FedRAMP Ready
Description: SandboxAQ achieves FedRAMP Ready status for AQtive Guard platform providing standardized path for federal agencies to evaluate automated cryptographic discovery.

OrgFullName: SandboxAQ MITRE and Linux Foundation PQCA
Title: RWPQC 2025 Conference
Description: SandboxAQ MITRE and Linux Foundation PQCA co-host Real World Post Quantum Cryptography (RWPQC) 2025 conference.

Title: Quantum-Safe Secure Element Pilot
Description: NXP begins sampling secure-element pilot incorporating PQShield quantum-safe core in Q3 2025.

Title: Initial PQC Planning Guide
Description: ASD publishes initial Planning for Post-Quantum Cryptography guidance.

Title: ISM December 2024 Update
Description: ASD updates ISM with specific PQC requirements (ISM-1917) including ML-DSA-87, ML-KEM-1024, SHA-384/512, AES-256 by 2030.

Title: Migration Planning Phase
Description: Organizations develop refined PQC transition plan accounting for security goals, risk tolerances, and data value.

Title: PQC Planning Guide Updated
Description: ASD publishes updated Planning for PQC guidance with LATICE framework and detailed milestones.

Title: Critical Systems Migration Start
Description: Implementation of PQC algorithms begins with most critical and sensitive systems.

Title: Full Migration Phase
Description: Complete transition to ASD-approved PQC algorithms across all systems.

Title: Traditional Crypto Prohibited
Description: Cease use of traditional asymmetric cryptography (RSA, ECDSA, ECDH). Full transition to PQC. 5 years ahead of US/UK.

Title: Paper 158 Quantum Roadmap
Description: BIS publishes Paper 158: Quantum-Readiness Roadmap for financial systems. Critical systems quantum-safe by early 2030s.

Title: PQC Best Practices Published
Description: CFDIR publishes Canadian National Quantum-Readiness Best Practices and Guidelines.

Title: PQC Migration Roadmap Published
Description: CCCS publishes ITSM.40.001 Roadmap for migration to PQC for Government of Canada. Effective June 23 2025.

Title: SPIN Notice Published
Description: Security Policy Implementation Notice on PQC migration effective October 9, 2025 under Policy on Government Security.

Title: Departmental Planning Phase
Description: Federal departments develop initial departmental PQC migration plans. Due by April 2026.

Title: Departmental PQC Migration Plans Due
Description: Federal departments must develop and submit initial PQC migration plans to CCCS by April 2026 with annual progress reporting thereafter. New IT procurements should include PQC vendor support clauses as an ongoing obligation under the roadmap.

Title: High Priority Migration Phase
Description: Migration of high priority government systems. Annual progress reporting required.

Title: High Priority Systems Complete
Description: Completion of PQC migration for high priority government systems.

Title: Remaining Systems Migration
Description: Migration of all remaining non-classified government systems.

Title: Full GC Migration Complete
Description: Completion of PQC migration for all Government of Canada non-classified systems.

Title: CACR PQC Competition Results
Description: CACR announces results of its post-quantum cryptography competition selecting initial algorithms (36 submissions).

Title: NGCC Program Launched
Description: China launches Next-Generation Commercial Cryptographic (NGCC) Algorithms Program for PQC standardization. Source article published February 18, 2025; program launch date per cited article.

Title: Hybrid Quantum-Safe System Launched
Description: China Telecom launches world's first distributed cryptography system combining QKD and PQC. Demonstrates quantum-encrypted communications across a 1,000km+ multi-city network spanning 16 cities (not the direct Beijing-Hefei distance of ~370km). Network includes Beijing-Hefei link.

Title: NGCC Algorithm Evaluation
Description: NGCC program evaluates submitted algorithms for security, performance, and implementation feasibility.

Title: Financial Sector Migration
Description: Mandated migration for critical financial infrastructure to quantum-safe cryptography.

OrgFullName: National Cyber and Information Security Agency
Title: Cryptographic Recommendations
Description: NUKIB publishes Minimum Requirements for cryptographic algorithms with PQC guidance.

OrgFullName: National Cyber and Information Security Agency
Title: Key Establishment Migration
Description: Migration for key establishment and encryption systems.

OrgFullName: National Cyber and Information Security Agency
Title: Encryption Migration Complete
Description: Complete migration by 2027 for key establishment and encryption. Firmware/software signing as soon as possible.

Title: PQC Integration Study
Description: ENISA publishes Post-Quantum Cryptography: Integration Study examining technology landscape.

Title: EU PQC Recommendation Published
Description: European Commission publishes Recommendation (EU) 2024/1101 on Coordinated Implementation Roadmap for PQC transition.

Title: Critical Infrastructure Migration
Description: Migration of critical infrastructure and high-risk systems to quantum-safe cryptography.

Title: Coordinated Roadmap v1.1
Description: NIS Cooperation Group publishes Coordinated Implementation Roadmap for PQC Transition Version 1.1.

OrgFullName: European Union Agency for Law Enforcement Cooperation
Title: QSFF Call to Action
Description: Europol Quantum Safe Financial Forum publishes call to action. Notes 86% of executives unprepared.

Title: EU PQC Survey Launched
Description: NIS Cooperation Group PQC Work Stream launches public survey to gather feedback on Coordinated Implementation Roadmap. Feedback deadline September 29, 2025.

Title: Agreed Cryptographic Algorithms v2
Description: ECCG publishes Agreed Cryptographic Algorithms version 2 (May 2025) with PQC guidance. Recommends PQ/T hybrid schemes and adjusted symmetric key lengths.

Title: Member State Strategy Initiation
Description: All EU Member States should initiate national PQC transition strategies by end of 2026.

Title: High-Risk Systems Secured
Description: Critical infrastructure and high-risk systems secured with PQC by 2030.

Title: Full EU PQC Transition
Description: Complete PQC transition for all feasible systems across EU member states.

OrgFullName: Agence nationale de la sécurité des systèmes d'information
Title: Initial PQC Position Paper
Description: ANSSI publishes initial position paper on post-quantum cryptography transition, mandating hybrid approach.

OrgFullName: Agence nationale de la sécurité des systèmes d'information
Title: PQC Position Paper Follow-up
Description: ANSSI publishes follow-up position paper with updated guidance on hybridization requirements.

Title: Joint QKD Position Paper
Description: ANSSI with BSI, NLNCSA, and Swedish NCSA publish joint Position Paper on Quantum Key Distribution. Recommends prioritizing PQC over QKD. January 26, 2024.

OrgFullName: Agence nationale de la sécurité des systèmes d'information
Title: PQC Market Studies Published
Description: ANSSI publishes two market studies on PQC readiness among French cybersecurity ecosystem (developers and consultants). Findings show significant preparedness gaps. November 25, 2024.

OrgFullName: Agence nationale de la sécurité des systèmes d'information
Title: Phase 1 - Pre-Quantum Security
Description: Mandatory pre-quantum security measures; PQC implementation optional but encouraged.

OrgFullName: Agence nationale de la sécurité des systèmes d'information
Title: Cryptographic Accreditation Doctrine Updated
Description: ANSSI Centre de Certification National (CCN) updates cryptographic accreditation doctrine to include PQC evaluation requirements. March 2025.

OrgFullName: Agence nationale de la sécurité des systèmes d'information
Title: CEA-Leti CESTI PQC Accreditation
Description: CEA-Leti becomes first CESTI (evaluation center) accredited by ANSSI to evaluate PQC solutions. September 29, 2025.

OrgFullName: Agence nationale de la sécurité des systèmes d'information
Title: First PQC Security Visas Issued
Description: ANSSI issues first French PQC security certifications: Thales Smartcard MultiApp 5.2 Premium PQC (Sept 29) and Samsung S3SSE2A microcontroller (Oct 1). Both include lattice-based algorithms.

OrgFullName: Agence nationale de la sécurité des systèmes d'information
Title: PQC FAQ Published
Description: ANSSI publishes comprehensive PQC FAQ covering algorithm recommendations (ML-KEM, ML-DSA, FN-DSA, SLH-DSA), hybridization requirements, and transition timeline. October 2025.

OrgFullName: Agence nationale de la sécurité des systèmes d'information
Title: PG-083 Cryptographic Guide Update (Planned)
Description: ANSSI plans to update Guide des mécanismes cryptographiques (PG-083) and algorithm selection guide to include PQC by end of 2025.

OrgFullName: Agence nationale de la sécurité des systèmes d'information
Title: Phase 2 - Hybridization Required
Description: Hybrid cryptography (classical + PQC) required for systems requiring post-quantum security assurance.

OrgFullName: Agence nationale de la sécurité des systèmes d'information
Title: IPsec DR Referential Update (Planned)
Description: ANSSI plans revision of IPsec DR referential to include PQC requirements. Expected 2026.

OrgFullName: Agence nationale de la sécurité des systèmes d'information
Title: PQC Qualification Requirement
Description: PQC integration mandatory for cryptographic solutions entering ANSSI qualification process, at least for certain product types. Starting 2027.

OrgFullName: Agence nationale de la sécurité des systèmes d'information
Title: Phase 3 - Standalone PQC Optional
Description: Standalone PQC becomes optional (not mandatory). Note: 2030 is when PQC alone becomes acceptable, not required.

Title: G7 Statement on Quantum Computing
Description: G7 issues statement on planning for opportunities and risks of quantum computing for cybersecurity, September 25, 2024.

Title: PQ.03 v2.0 Guidelines
Description: GSMA Post Quantum Telco Network Task Force publishes PQ.03 v2.0 covering telecom use cases (October 2024).

OrgFullName: Bundesamt für Sicherheit in der Informationstechnik
Title: EU Joint Statement on PQC
Description: BSI initiates joint statement with 18 EU member states (later 21) urging PQC transition, November 27, 2024.

OrgFullName: Bundesamt für Sicherheit in der Informationstechnik
Title: TR-02102-1 PQC Update
Description: BSI publishes Version 2025-01 of TR-02102-1 with significant PQC recommendations including ML-KEM and ML-DSA.

Title: Quantum-Secure ID Card Demonstrator
Description: World's first functional quantum-secure ID card demonstrator unveiled November 10-11, 2025 with BSI, Bundesdruckerei, G+D, Infineon.

Title: QUANTITY Initiative Launched
Description: BSI and DLR launch QUANTITY initiative in March 2025 focusing on quantum cryptanalysis to strengthen algorithm selection and validate PQC security.

OrgFullName: Bundesamt für Sicherheit in der Informationstechnik
Title: Critical Applications PQC
Description: Most sensitive and critical applications should be PQC-protected by end of 2030.

Title: TEC Technical Report Published
Description: TEC publishes Technical Report TEC 910018:2025 on Migration to Post-Quantum Cryptography, January 2025.

Title: BOM Guidelines Expanded
Description: CERT-In expands Bill of Materials requirements to include Cryptographic BOM (CBOM) and Quantum Readiness BOM (QBOM).

Title: PQC Migration Roadmap Published
Description: PQCC publishes comprehensive PQC Migration Roadmap in May 2025 with four-category framework: Preparation, Baseline Understanding, Planning and Execution, Monitoring and Evaluation.

Title: PQC Readiness Guide Published
Description: Organizational Cyber Readiness to the Post-Quantum Age guidance published January 2022.

Title: National Cybersecurity Strategy 2025-2028
Description: INCD publishes National Cybersecurity Strategy including quantum threat mitigation provisions.

Title: Banking PQC Directive
Description: Bank of Israel issues Directive Letter 202501EN (January 7, 2025) requiring financial institutions to manage quantum risk.

Title: Government Threat Assessment
Description: All government ministries must complete quantum threat assessment and require PQC in new contracts by end of 2025.

OrgFullName: Israel National Cyber Directorate / Bank of Israel
Title: Inventory & Planning Phase
Description: Organizations create cryptographic inventory, add PQC to contracts, develop initial plans.

Title: PQC Guidance Published
Description: ACN publishes 'Crittografia Post-Quantum e Quantistica: Preparazione alla Minaccia Quantistica' guidance.

Title: PQC Guideline GL-2004-2022
Description: CRYPTREC publishes Guidelines for Post-Quantum Cryptography technical guidance.

OrgFullName: New Energy and Industrial Technology Development Organization
Title: K Program PQC Research
Description: NEDO K Program research on PQC implementation technologies. Final standardization documents due 2026.

OrgFullName: National center of Incident readiness and Strategy for Cybersecurity
Title: PQC Migration Planning
Description: Following NIST standardization, focusing on lattice-based and hash-based algorithms. CRYPTREC preparing detailed guidelines.

Title: Cybersecurity Industry Policy Package
Description: METI releases policy package for strengthening Japan's cybersecurity industry including PQC. METI and NISC establish shared vision for Software Bill of Materials in September 2025.

Title: QKD High-Speed Data Integration Demo
Description: NEC, NICT, and Toshiba unveil world's first integrated system for QKD and high-speed data transmission in large-capacity optical network. September 2025.

OrgFullName: National center of Incident readiness and Strategy for Cybersecurity
Title: Critical Systems Migration
Description: Target for migrating critical government systems. Dual-track approach: PQC and QKD technologies.

Title: Quantum Technologies Strategy
Description: NATO publishes first Quantum Technologies Strategy January 17, 2024 committing to PQC transition.

Title: NZISM v3.8 Updated
Description: New Zealand Information Security Manual updated with PQC guidance.

Title: Planning Phase
Description: Organizations start planning for PQC transition.

Title: NZISM v3.9 Published
Description: NZISM Version 3.9 (November 2025) includes Section 2.4 on PQC preparation. 19 agencies implementing.

Title: Transition Phase
Description: Transition to PQC begins from 2026-27 across government agencies.

Title: Initial PQC Guidance
Description: CSA issues initial guidance on quantum computing threats and PQC preparation.

Title: Financial Services PQC Advisory
Description: MAS issues Circular MAS/TCRS/2024/01 requiring financial services to prepare PQC transition plan, February 20, 2024.

OrgFullName: Cyber Security Agency / Monetary Authority of Singapore
Title: Financial Sector Planning
Description: Financial services firms develop quantum risk management and PQC transition plans per MAS advisory.

Title: Quantum-Safe Handbook Released
Description: CSA releases Quantum-Safe Handbook and Quantum Readiness Index for public consultation at SICW 2025.

Title: Financial Sector QKD Sandbox Completed
Description: MAS completes QKD proof-of-concept sandbox (Sept 2024-March 2025). DBS, HSBC, OCBC, UOB tested QKD for settlement files. Generated 6.75M AES-256 keys/day per bank.

Title: KpqC Competition Results
Description: Korea Post-Quantum Cryptography Competition winners announced January 16, 2025: HAETAE, AIMer, SMAUG-T, NTRU+.

Title: Pilot Transition Phase
Description: Initial implementation period for PQC in government and critical sectors.

Title: Full PQC Roadmap Complete
Description: Target completion of national PQC transition roadmap.

Title: Four-Phase PQC Approach
Description: CCN defines four-phase approach from today through post-2030. Recommends NIST algorithms and FrodoKEM.

Title: PQC Transition Period
Description: Four-phase approach implementation period.

Title: Five-Year PQC Plan
Description: Taiwan launches five-year PQC implementation plan targeting quantum-safe government systems.

Title: Interim Quantum-Safe Milestone
Description: Interim target within Taiwan's 2024-2029 five-year PQC plan for quantum-safe upgrades to priority government digital infrastructure.

Title: PQC White Paper Updated
Description: NCSC updates PQC White Paper to endorse NIST quantum-safe algorithms. First major jurisdiction to reflect NIST algorithms.

Title: PQC Migration Roadmap Published
Description: NCSC publishes comprehensive three-phase PQC migration roadmap with specific milestones through 2035.

Title: Financial Sector PQC Guidance
Description: CMORG publishes Guidance for Post-Quantum Cryptography v1.0 for UK financial sector (April 2025). Note: direct PDF link may require retrieval from cmorg.org.uk.

OrgFullName: Department for Science Innovation and Technology
Title: CNI Perspectives Report
Description: DSIT publishes Perspectives on the Plan for PQC Transition covering five CNI sectors.

Title: Discovery & Planning Phase
Description: Organizations complete full discovery of cryptographic services needing upgrades and draft migration plan.

Title: Priority Migration Phase
Description: Execute high-priority PQC upgrades, refine plans, and prepare infrastructure for full transition.

Title: Full Migration Phase
Description: Complete migration to PQC for all systems, services, and products.

Title: Full PQC Compliance
Description: Target for full compliance with PQC standards across all government and critical sectors.

Title: NSM-10 Published
Description: National Security Memorandum on Promoting U.S. Leadership in Quantum Computing while Mitigating Risks to Vulnerable Cryptographic Systems.

Title: M-23-02 Cryptographic Inventory
Description: OMB Memorandum requiring federal agencies to submit cryptographic system inventories per NSM-10.

Title: Quantum Computing Cybersecurity Preparedness Act
Description: H.R.7535 signed into law requiring OMB to prioritize federal agency migration to PQC.

Title: CNSA 2.0 Published
Description: NSA publishes Commercial National Security Algorithm Suite 2.0 with quantum-resistant algorithm requirements.

Title: Software/Firmware Signing Transition
Description: Begin transitioning immediately; support and prefer CNSA 2.0 by 2025 for software and firmware signing.

OrgFullName: National Institute of Standards and Technology / NSA
Title: Cryptographic Inventory
Description: Federal agencies perform comprehensive cryptographic inventory using ACDI tools per NSM-10.

OrgFullName: National Institute of Standards and Technology
Title: FIPS 203, 204, 205 Published
Description: NIST releases the first set of PQC standards for ML-KEM (FIPS 203), ML-DSA (FIPS 204), and SLH-DSA (FIPS 205). Effective August 13, 2024.

OrgFullName: National Institute of Standards and Technology
Title: NIST IR 8547 Transition Guidance (Draft)
Description: NIST publishes Initial Public Draft guidance for transition to PQC standards, proposing deprecation timelines.

Title: PQC Report to Congress
Description: White House publishes July 2024 Report on Post-Quantum Cryptography estimating $7.1B government-wide migration cost (2025-2035).

Title: CNSA 2.0 Algorithms Revised
Description: NSA publishes revised CNSA 2.0 algorithm document (May 2025) specifying ML-KEM-1024 ML-DSA-87 AES-256 SHA-384/512 LMS and XMSS as required quantum-resistant algorithms for National Security Systems.

Title: Automated PQC Discovery Strategy
Description: CISA publishes Strategy for Migrating to Automated Post-Quantum Cryptography Discovery and Inventory Tools.

Title: PQC Considerations for OT
Description: CISA publishes Post-Quantum Considerations for Operational Technology guidance for critical infrastructure.

Title: Web/Cloud Services Transition
Description: Support and prefer CNSA 2.0 by 2025 for web browsers/servers and cloud services.

Title: Traditional Networking Transition
Description: Support and prefer CNSA 2.0 by 2026 for traditional networking equipment (VPNs, routers).

OrgFullName: National Institute of Standards and Technology
Title: HQC Selected as Fifth Algorithm
Description: NIST selects HQC (Hamming Quasi-Cyclic) as backup KEM algorithm based on code-based cryptography.

Title: Executive Order 14144
Description: Biden administration EO on cybersecurity including PQC provisions, issued January 16, 2025.

Title: Executive Order 14306 Issued
Description: Trump administration issues Executive Order 14306 on June 6 2025 amending EO 14144 and EO 13694 while sustaining select cybersecurity efforts including PQC migration provisions.

OrgFullName: National Institute of Standards and Technology
Title: IR 8547 Public Comments Published
Description: NIST publishes all public comments received on IR 8547 draft. Comment period closed January 10, 2025. Final version in development.

OrgFullName: National Institute of Standards and Technology
Title: FIPS 206 (FN-DSA) Draft Submitted
Description: NIST submits draft standard for FN-DSA (FIPS 206) based on FALCON algorithm for approval. Initial Public Draft expected Q4 2025. Final standard expected late 2026/early 2027.

OrgFullName: National Institute of Standards and Technology
Title: Sixth PQC Standardization Conference
Description: NIST holds Sixth PQC Standardization Conference in September 2025 to discuss algorithm updates, FIPS 206, and migration guidance.

OrgFullName: NIST National Cybersecurity Center of Excellence
Title: CSWP 48 PQC Migration Mappings Draft
Description: NCCoE publishes initial draft of Cybersecurity White Paper 48 - Mappings of Migration to PQC Project Capabilities to Risk Framework Documents (CSF 2.0, SP 800-53). Comment period closed October 20, 2025.

Title: Operating Systems Transition
Description: Support and prefer CNSA 2.0 by 2027 for operating systems.

Title: ACDI Deployment Phase
Description: Federal agencies deploy Automated Cryptographic Discovery and Inventory (ACDI) tools per CISA strategy to complete cryptographic inventories.

OrgFullName: NIST National Cybersecurity Center of Excellence
Title: PQC Interoperability Testing
Description: NCCoE performs interoperability testing of standardized PQC algorithms in common protocols.

Title: Large PKI Systems Migration
Description: Migration of large public key infrastructure systems to CNSA 2.0 algorithms.

OrgFullName: National Institute of Standards and Technology
Title: HQC Standard Finalized (Expected)
Description: Final standard incorporating HQC algorithm expected to be published approximately one year after draft.

Title: NSS Acquisitions CNSA 2.0 Required
Description: New National Security Systems acquisitions must be CNSA 2.0 compliant starting January 2027.

OrgFullName: National Institute of Standards and Technology
Title: 112-bit Security Deprecated
Description: Algorithms at 112-bit security strength (e.g., RSA-2048, DH-2048, ECDH P-256) deprecated per NIST IR 8547 (draft). Disallowed in federal systems after 2035. Systems must migrate to 128-bit minimum (AES-256, SHA-384+) or approved PQC algorithms.

Title: CNSA 2.0 Exclusive - Network/Signing
Description: Exclusively use CNSA 2.0 for software/firmware signing and traditional networking equipment.

Title: NSS Quantum Resistant Majority
Description: Vast majority of cryptography in National Security Systems should be quantum resistant.

Title: CNSA 2.0 Exclusive - OS/Web/Cloud
Description: Exclusively use CNSA 2.0 for web browsers/servers, cloud services, operating systems, and large PKI systems.

Title: Full CNSA 2.0 Transition Complete
Description: Complete transition to CNSA 2.0 algorithms for all National Security Systems (NSS).

Title: CISA PQC Product Category List Publication
Description: CISA released initial list of product categories supporting PQC per Executive Order. List developed with ATARC covering data management, networking, and enterprise endpoint security. Products must be generally available, FIPS-compliant, and interoperable.

Title: CNSA 1.0 Compliance Deadline for NSS
Description: All existing National Security Systems must be CNSA 1.0 compliant  or submit waiver request by end of year. Systems not compliant have 6 months to achieve CNSA 2.0 compliance or request waiver.

Title: PKI Consortium PQC Conference 2025 Conclusions
Description: World's largest PQC conference concluded in Kuala Lumpur with 2500+ delegates from 30+ countries. Issued urgent global call for immediate action on PQC migration. Next conference announced for Germany 2026.

Title: NIST PQC Algorithms in Windows Platform
Description: Microsoft announced general availability of NIST post-quantum cryptography algorithms ML-KEM and ML-DSA in Windows 11 and Windows Server 2025 via November 2025 update  enabling enterprise PQC adoption.

Title: US Post-Quantum Root of Trust Service Launch
Description: SEALSQ launched US-based Post-Quantum Root of Trust service for enterprises and government agencies aligned with NIST PQC standards and NSA CNSA 2.0 framework integrating with Quantum Shield QS7001 hardware.

Title: ML-KEM Embedded Secure Element Breakthrough
Description: Samsung System LSI and Thales announce breakthrough in embedded security bringing ML-KEM quantum-resistant capabilities to tiny secure elements in electronic devices. First commercial PQC implementation for IoT and embedded systems.

Title: RFC 9794 PQC Hybrid Terminology
Description: IETF publishes RFC 9794 Terminology for Post-Quantum Traditional Hybrid Schemes. Standardizes definitions for hybrid PQC/classical cryptographic schemes. Over 20 IETF drafts now reference this standard.

Title: PQC Inventory Workbook Published
Description: PQCC publishes PQC Inventory Workbook to assist organizations in creating centralized inventory for tracking cryptographic migration efforts. Follows May 2025 PQC Migration Roadmap. Founded by IBM, Microsoft, MITRE, PQShield, SandboxAQ.

Title: Helios Quantum Computer Commercial Launch
Description: Quantinuum launches Helios commercial quantum computer with 98 all-to-all connected qubits and industry-leading fidelity (99.9975% single-qubit 99.921% two-qubit gate fidelity). Designed to enable Generative Quantum AI.

Title: National Quantum Initiative Reauthorization Act
Description: Bipartisan legislation introduced to extend National Quantum Initiative by 5 years to December 2034. Authorizes $85M/yr for NIST quantum centers, creates 5 NSF Multidisciplinary Centers for Quantum Research. Endorsed by IBM Microsoft Google IonQ.

Title: Financial Sector PQC Roadmap
Description: G7 Cyber Expert Group (chaired by US Treasury and Bank of England) releases Advancing a Coordinated Roadmap for PQC Transition in Financial Sector. Recommends critical financial systems quantum-safe by 2030-2032, non-critical by 2035.

Title: Federal PQC Procurement Guidance
Description: CISA issues federal buying guidance per EO 14306 directing agencies to acquire only PQC-capable products in widely available categories: cloud services, collaboration tools, browsers, and endpoint security. Networking and identity management still transitioning.

Title: Post-Quantum Security Top Priority
Description: Ethereum Foundation elevates post-quantum security to top strategic priority. Forms dedicated PQ team, launches $2M in bounties (Poseidon Prize $1M and Proximity Prize $1M), and begins bi-weekly PQ All Core Devs calls February 2026.

OrgFullName: Quantinuum and Singapore National Quantum Office
Title: Helios Quantum Computer Singapore Deployment
Description: Quantinuum partners with Singapore National Quantum Office to deploy Helios quantum computer (98 qubits) first deployment outside US. R&D and Operations Centre established at one-north technology district.

OrgFullName: ETSI and University of Waterloo IQC
Title: ETSI/IQC QSC Conference 2026
Description: 11th ETSI/IQC Quantum Safe Cryptography Conference announced for Ottawa, hosted by Carleton University June 16-18. Topics include PQC deployments, QKD, migration challenges, and cryptographic agility.
